summary: This is a U.S. Marshals Service prisoner schedule report for the Brooklyn Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) dated July 31, 2019. It lists multiple inmates scheduled for various court proceedings (transfers, hearings, pleas, arraignments, sentencings) before different federal judges in New York. The document includes inmate IDs, security/medical cautions, and offenses, but does not name the inmates.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: Presiding over a status hearing for an inmate with offense code 3599 (Dangerous Drugs) at Brooklyn MDC Court.

persons.name: Judge Daniels
persons.context: Presiding over a change of plea hearing for an inmate charged with wire fraud (Offense 2608) at Brooklyn MDC Court.

persons.name: Judge Crotty
persons.context: Presiding over multiple proceedings (sentencing, change of plea, status hearing) for inmates charged with dangerous drugs offenses at Brooklyn MDC Court.

persons.name: Judge Failla
persons.context: Presiding over an 'Other' proceeding (described as 'CHANGE OF COUNSEL') for an inmate charged with dangerous drugs and noted as a 'HOOLY GANG MEMBER'.

persons.name: Judge Pauley
persons.context: Presiding over a bond hearing for an inmate charged with dangerous drugs at Brooklyn MDC Court.

persons.name: Judge Rakoff
persons.context: Presiding over a sentencing hearing for an inmate charged with dangerous drugs at Brooklyn MDC Court.

persons.name: Judge Caproni
persons.context: Presiding over a change of plea hearing for an inmate with extensive medical issues (asthma, torn ACL, high blood pressure, history of drug abuse) charged with dangerous drugs.

events.title: Brooklyn MDC Court Docket
events.description: A series of scheduled court proceedings for inmates at the Brooklyn Metropolitan Detention Center, including transfers, status hearings, changes of plea, arraignments, sentencings, and bond hearings.

keyFacts: This is a routine prisoner transport and court schedule from the Brooklyn MDC dated July 31, 2019, the day after Jeffrey Epstein's arrest (July 30, 2019).
None of the listed inmates are identified by name, only by prisoner number, demographic data, offense codes, and security/medical cautions.
The offenses listed for the scheduled inmates are primarily '3599 Dangerous Drugs', with one case of wire fraud and one weapons possession.
The document shows no direct mention of Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, or any known associates or victims from the Epstein case.
The schedule involves multiple federal judges in the Southern District of New York, indicating standard court operations for the detention center.
